report_title: Promotional Products Manufacturing in the US
executive_summary: Promotional product manufacturers design and distribute promotional products for various sectors. Manufacturers have benefited from largely favorable economic conditions over the last few years but haven't been exempt from the COVID-19 pandemic's disruptions and subsequent inflation. Growth in the number of businesses and corporate profit have fueled demand for promotional products since new companies use them to generate consumer awareness and favorability around their brand. In 2020, the pandemic temporarily upturned the industry's growth as the associated economic downturn and stay-at-home orders hindered spending from businesses struggling with faltering revenue. Manufacturers enjoyed a surge in revenue in 2021 as recovery pushed corporate profit through the roof. Since then, corporate profit has gone on to regress and even decline starting in 2023 amid interest rate hikes. Industry revenue is set to sink at a CAGR of 1.4% to $17.8 billion through the end of 2024, including a stumble of 0.2% in 2024 alone.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Corporate Profit Volatility Has Thrown Industry Enterprises Into Flux
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Wild fluctuations in corporate profit have added volatility to the industry. While typically stable, the disruption of the COVID-19 pandemic led to a dip in corporate profit in 2020 before a major spike in 2021 as recovery brought a jump in revenue for many industries.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Markets Have Expanded Amid Postpandemic Growth
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Large corporations with substantial profitability often drive industry innovation. Their willingness to experiment with new, higher-cost promotional products motivates suppliers to develop novel and more sophisticated offerings. This ripple effect helps elevate industry standards and expand the range of available products.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: External Competition from Other Advertisers is Heating Up
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The promotional products industry has faced increased competition from external sources such as digital marketing and social media advertising. Businesses are now allocating larger portions of their marketing budgets to online channels offering targeted and measurable results.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Recovering Downstream Markets Will Boost Revenue
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Growth in the business sentiment index, consumer spending and corporate profit will expand many companies' advertising expenditures, increasing demand for promotional products.

- Advances in printing technology allow for more on-demand customization, where each item can be personalized with the recipient's name or unique attributes. More companies are investing in variable data printing, producing items that can be personalized with unique data for each recipient.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: MERGERS AND ACQUISITIONS WILL RAMP UP, PROMOTING PROFIT
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: For companies in this mature industry, acquisitions become a popular and crucial way to grow their market share as organic growth from expanding demand slows down. Mergers and acquisitions may gain traction, especially as the industry becomes more saturated and enterprise growth resumes.

industry_definition: Companies in this industry design and distribute promotional products (e.g., key chains, magnets and pens). They also provide various advertising-related services, including sign lettering and window dressing. This industry doesn't include advertising agency services, public relations agency services, media-buying agency services, media representative services, display-advertising services, direct-mail-advertising services or marketing consulting services.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Customization and Distribution of Promotional Products
products_and_services.product_description: Promotional products are an effective form of advertising since they enable companies to efficiently reach target audiences. Common customizable promotional products include T-shirts, electronics and tech accessories, bags, magnets, writing instruments, apparel, headwear, food and desk and office accessories.

This product segment includes custom fabrication services of banners, a-frame signs, neon signs and sign lettering and painting services. Glass gilding services and mural and sign hand-painting services are also included in this segment but are not significant revenue generators.

A product or merchandise demonstration introduces the product to customers while providing favorable information and any necessary instructions. Product or merchandise demonstrations include contracted food and beverage sampling services, health and beauty presentations and contract product training services.

Services in this segment include sales promotion, advertising placement and creative services, direct marketing, media-buying, media representation and distribution of advertising materials, among others.
